item.title: 廉价股票和市场改革吸引投资者投资沙特
item.description: 尽管目前沙特股市表现不佳，交易量也在下降，但一连串的改革措施正在使外国人更容易在沙特投资，从而增强了投资者的信心，相信沙特股市终有一天会与全球竞争对手一较高下。【原文：A rush of reforms is making it easier for foreigners to invest in Saudi Arabia, boosting confidence among investors that the country’s stock market will one day compete with global rivals even as equities currently underperform and trading volumes decline.】

item.title: 中国寻求减少生猪饲养量以缓解供过于求的局面
item.description: 中国正在敦促养猪大户将种猪数量减少约 2%，这是中国为解决食品行业供过于求问题而采取的最新举措，供过于求引发了对通货紧缩的担忧。【原文：China is urging top pig farmers to scale back breeding herds by about 2%, the latest push to tackle oversupply in the country’s food sector, which has sparked concerns over deflation.】

item.title: 发达国家对瑞士征收美国最高关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的最高关税之一现已对瑞士生效，此前瑞士政府为争取美国总统降低税率所做的最后努力以失败告终。【原文：One of Donald Trump’s highest tariffs is now in effect on Switzerland after the government failed in its last-ditch effort to get the US president to lower the rate.】

item.title: 获胜股票总是统治市场，但从未像现在这样
item.description:
选股人该做什么？然而，狭隘的市场正是资本主义的一贯产物。【原文：

What’s a stock picker to do? Yet narrow markets are what capitalism always produces.

】

item.title: 欧洲央行的 2% 降准掩盖了欧元区通胀的巨大波幅
item.description: 欧洲中央银行的官员们在庆祝欧元区实现物价稳定的同时也要注意：2% 的通胀率只是相对而言。【原文：For European Central Bank officials marking the achievement of price stability within the euro zone, there’s a caveat: inflation at 2% is all a bit relative.】

item.title: 摩根大通、德国商业银行和荷兰国际集团支持欧洲国防银行
item.description: 摩根大通（JP Morgan Chase & Co）、德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）和荷兰国际集团（ING Group NV）已为一家新的全欧洲银行提供支持，该银行旨在促进整个地区的安全支出。【原文：JP Morgan Chase & Co, Commerzbank AG and ING Group NV have given their backing to a new Europe-wide bank designed to boost security spending across the region, according to the development group guiding its creation.】

item.title: 捷克将维持利率不变，宽松政策有望结束：决策指南
item.description: 在一些决策者发出结束宽松货币政策的信号后，捷克央行准备在第二次会议上维持利率不变。【原文：The Czech central bank is poised to hold interest rates for a second meeting after some policymakers signaled an end to monetary easing.】

item.title: 台积电股价大涨，因台湾方面称该公司不受特朗普关税影响
item.description: 台湾表示，其领先的芯片制造商将不必为进口到美国的此类产品支付 100% 的关税，这帮助推动台湾半导体制造股份有限公司的股价创下历史新高。【原文：Taiwan said its leading chip manufacturer will not have to pay a 100% tariff on such imports to the US, helping drive Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares to a record.】

item.title: 特朗普对印度的惩罚性关税破坏了莫迪的俄罗斯石油计划
item.description: 美国决定对印度商品加倍征收关税，作为对印度持续购买俄罗斯原油的惩罚，这使印度这个世界第三大石油消费国陷入困境，其炼油厂也陷入混乱，但此举不太可能促使新德里进行彻底反思。【原文：A US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods as punishment for ongoing purchases of Russian crude leaves the world’s third-largest oil consumer in a tight spot and its refiners in disarray, but the move is unlikely to prompt a radical rethink in New Delhi.】

item.title: 融资谈判报告发布后，新世界股票和债券大涨
item.description: 香港建筑商新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：Distressed Hong Kong builder New World Development Co.’s shares and dollar bonds rose the most in several months after a report that the company and its controlling family are in talks for a potential financing deal for as much as $2.5 billion.】

item.title: 越航将新聘 5000 多名泰籍员工以扩大规模
item.description: 越南最大的廉价航空公司 VietJet Aviation JSC 计划在泰国新聘 5000 多名员工，加快向东南亚最受欢迎的旅游目的地扩展航班和航线。【原文：VietJet Aviation JSC plans to employ more than 5,000 new staff in Thailand as Vietnam’s biggest budget carrier accelerates flight and route expansion to Southeast Asia’s most popular travel destination.】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，中国出口增长仍意外加快
item.description: 中国上个月的出口增长意外加快，创下自 4 月份以来的最快增幅。【原文：China’s export growth unexpectedly accelerated last month in the fastest gain since April.】

item.title: 尽管面临关税威胁，索尼仍上调娱乐业需求展望
item.description: 索尼集团公司周四上调了盈利预期，因为其娱乐部门的强劲表现超过了美国对芯片征收新关税的威胁。【原文：Sony Group Corp. raised its earnings forecast on Thursday after a strong showing from its entertainment divisions that outweighed the threat of new US tariffs on chips.】

item.title: 日本公务员将获得 34 年来最大一次加薪
item.description: 日本公务员将获得 34 年来最大的加薪幅度，此举可能会进一步加强日本央行长期以来一直寻求的工资和物价增长的良性循环，而这是继续收紧货币政策的前提条件。【原文：Japan’s civil servants are set to receive the biggest pay increase in 34 years, a move that could further reinforce the virtuous cycle of wage and price growth long sought by the Bank of Japan as a precondition for continuing monetary tightening.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税，印度投资者更加谨慎
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 克普勒称俄罗斯输往印度的石油价格因制裁和威胁而下跌
item.description: 据数据情报公司 Kpler Ltd.称，由于欧盟的制裁和美国的惩罚威胁给需求前景蒙上阴影，俄罗斯原油正以较低的价格提供给印度买家。【原文：Russian crude is being offered to Indian buyers at lower prices as European Union sanctions and threats of penalties from the US cloud the demand outlook, according to data intelligence firm Kpler Ltd.】

item.title: 越南监管机构下令加强股票交易监管
item.description: 在市场近期大幅反弹之后，越南国家证券委员会已指示证券交易所和相关机构加强对股票交易的监管。【原文：Vietnam’s State Securities Commission has directed stock exchanges and relevant agencies to strengthen supervision of equity transactions following a recent sharp rally in the market.】

item.title: 东京电子解雇涉嫌窃取台积电技术的工人
item.description: 东京电子有限公司（Tokyo Electron Ltd.）表示，该公司已经解雇了其台北分公司的一名员工，这是该公司自岛国政府逮捕六名涉嫌窃取台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（TSMC）商业机密的人员以来首次发表公开声明。【原文：Tokyo Electron Ltd. said it’s fired an employee at its Taipei unit, making its first public statement since the island’s government arrested six people suspected of stealing trade secrets from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.】

item.title: 美国竞争对手 Cboe 挑战市场主导地位后，澳大利亚证券交易所股价跳水
item.description: 由于来自 Cboe Global Markets Inc 的潜在市场竞争以及监管问题，澳大利亚陷入困境的主要交易所运营商 ASX Ltd 股价创下两年来最大跌幅。【原文：ASX Ltd shares tumbled the most in two years as potential market competition from Cboe Global Markets Inc and regulatory issues weigh on Australia’s embattled main exchange operator.】

item.title: 李明博称贸易协议缓解了韩国利率决议前的压力
item.description: 韩国银行行长李昌镛（Rhee Chang Yong）表示，韩国与美国达成的贸易协议 "有助于减轻 "本月利率决议前的 "重大负担"。【原文：South Korea’s trade deal with the US “helped ease a significant burden” before this month’s rate decision, Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang Yong said.】

item.title: 菲律宾经济在美国关税动荡中超出预期
item.description: 在美国关税威胁全球贸易之际，菲律宾第二季度经济增长超过预期，凸显了这个依赖消费的国家的韧性。【原文：The Philippine economy grew more than expected in the second quarter, highlighting the consumption-reliant nation’s resilience as US tariffs threaten global trade.】

item.title: 巴西苏扎诺公司因关税不确定性削减纸浆产量
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收贸易关税的不确定性，巴西苏扎诺公司（Suzano SA）与最大市场中国客户的谈判受到影响，该公司正在削减木浆产量。【原文：Brazilian company Suzano SA is cutting wood-pulp production after negotiations with clients in China, its biggest market, were hit by uncertainty over US President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs.】

item.title: 能源资本成为 31 亿美元 GFL 交易的领跑者
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Energy Capital Partners 正在就收购 GFL Environmental Inc.【原文：Energy Capital Partners is in advanced negotiations to buy a minority stake in GFL Environmental Inc.’s infrastructure affiliate, with the deal expected to value the business at around C$4.25 billion ($3.1 billion) including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 苹果扩大长达 18 年之久的 iPhone 玻璃交易以规避特朗普关税
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc.首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）正在使用一种熟悉的策略来博得唐纳德-特朗普的好感：扩大现有计划，以表明他支持总统的 "美国制造 "议程。【原文：Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook is using a familiar strategy to stay in Donald Trump’s good graces: expanding existing initiatives to show he supports the president’s “Made in the USA” agenda.】

item.title: 关税叠加的困惑阻碍了日本达成美国贸易协议的努力
item.description: 本周四，日本首席谈判代表访问华盛顿，要求落实将汽车进口税削减至 15%的承诺，这凸显了对日美贸易协议的新的解释分歧。【原文：A fresh discrepancy in interpretations of the US-Japan trade deal came to the fore on Thursday, as Japan’s chief negotiator visits Washington to press for follow-through on a pledge to cut a levy on car imports to 15%.】

item.title: 印尼开始首次分两期发售袋鼠债券
item.description: 印度尼西亚周四开始发售首只以澳元计价的袋鼠债券，以寻求多元化的资金来源。【原文：Indonesia started offering its first Australian dollar-denominated Kangaroo bond Thursday as the country sought to diversify funding sources.】

item.title: 资生堂利润超出预期，最高跃升 11
item.description: 资生堂公司第二季度利润超出预期，该公司股价周四上午大涨 11%，创近四个月来最大涨幅。【原文：Shiseido Co. shares surged as much as 11% on Thursday morning, the most in nearly four months, after the company’s second quarter profit beat estimates.】

item.title: 特朗普关税议程成为头条新闻，黄金止跌回升
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的最新贸易举措，包括威胁对芯片进口征收 100%的关税，给黄金带来了不确定性，但黄金仍保持温和跌势。【原文：Gold held a moderate loss, as traders looked past uncertainty created by US President Donald Trump’s latest trade moves, including threatening a 100% tariff on chip imports.】

item.title: 美联储降息押注将使印尼债券比同行更受提振
item.description: 随着对美联储降息预期的不断升温，印尼债券很可能成为亚洲最大的受益者，从而刺激整个地区出现一连串的上涨。【原文：Indonesian bonds are likely to be the biggest beneficiary in Asia as growing expectations of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts spur a cascade of gains across the region.】

item.title: 交易员撇清美国对俄举动的影响，石油保持跌势
item.description: 石油连续五天下跌，创下自一月份以来的最长跌势，原因是投资者在追踪美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动停止乌克兰战争的外交努力的同时，也在关注美国惩罚俄罗斯原油买家的努力。【原文：Oil held a five-day decline — the longest losing run since January — as investors looked beyond US efforts to punish buyers of Russian crude, while tracking a diplomatic push by President Donald Trump to halt the war in Ukraine.】
